text: Just yesterday. I did one few days back that lingered, then went to update it with the bot to the latest commit but unknown to me the first one got merged around the same time. Then Dillum had an update he wanted out. So 3 landed yesterday

text: Short answer, there was stuff people wanted to get tested on nightly

text: Should this just happen automatically one a day for all stdlibs?

text: Yeah that sounds like a good idea

text: I really think it should probably be even simpler than it already is an just use the same branch every time so that if there’s an existing PR that isn’t merged yet it gets updated

text: I actually originally had it set up to run a daily cron job, but I removed it.... because I thought people would complain that it was too noisy :joy:
